descriptionHtml:
Requiem - Invisibility Glitch - Eyes Fix
A requified patch to [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/users/6335298]jimkaiseriv[/url]'s combination of eye fixes, to remove the eye glitch people were somehow having, I have no idea how the glitch works but I'm providing a patch for Requiem.

This will not work for follower frameworks such as EFF because it uses it's own invisibility spell to hide followers.

You need this mod for the patch to work! [size=3]http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/63451/? 

Installation:
[/size]Either install with your favorite mod manager or just copy to Skyrim data folder.

If installing with a Mod Organizer you can merge with the original mod to save a mod folder slot. Otherwise manage this however you want.

Also, it's important to note that you need to disable the original eye fix esp! That's why i haven't put it in this load order below.

[size=3]Load order:[/size]

Skyrim.esm
Update.esm
Dawnguard.esm
-
AOS.esp
.
Requiem.esp
Requiem - Legendary Bugsmasher Edition.esp
.

Requiem - Audio Overhaul for Skyrim.esp - If you have this patch
.
Requiem - InvisEyeFixes (- AOS)
.

[size=4]This is a MUST, even if LOOT tells you otherwise![/size]

[b][size=3]Credits[/size][/b]

[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/users/3021900]bellywood2206[/url] for the meshes in their mod [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/50132/?]Eye Glitch Fix[/url].

[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/users/1892262]KingsGambit[/url] for their mod [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/23916/?]Invisibility Glitch - Eyes Fix[/url]. The scripts used here are entirely new, but the use of QueueNiNodeUpdate() is based on their approach.

[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/users/6335298]jimkaiseriv[/url] for combining both mods to make the fix more effective.
author: darkangelmn
